paper.title: Verifying omega-Regular Properties for a Subclass of Linear Hybrid Systems
paper.abstract: We address the problem of verifying untimed ω-regular properties for a subclass of linear hybrid systems, i.e., finite transition graphs supplied with real-valued variables that change continuously with integer rates at each control location. The systems we consider are systems with two variables, one of them must be monotonic (e.g., with rates either 0 or 1) whereas the other one can have rates either −1, 0, or 1. We prove that for these systems, the verification problem of ω-regular properties is decidable. For that, we show that these systems generate ω-context-free sets of state sequences.
